alert.note: Alert for Fillmore (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 9:08PM CDT until July 05 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Fillmore County in south central Nebraska... * Until 315 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 908 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in central Fillmore County, including flooding in Shickley. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Geneva, Shickley, Milligan, Grafton, Ohiowa and Strang. This includes the following streams and drainages... Indian Creek, Walnut Creek, Dry Sandy Creek, South Fork Johnson Creek, Big Sandy Creek, West Fork Big Blue River, Elk Run Creek, Little Sandy Creek, School Creek and Turkey Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
